ThingDef.label: megascarab
ThingDef.description: A large, genetically-engineered beetle. Once the worker caste of an artifical ecosystem of insectoids designed to fight mechanoid invasions, it is now usually seen without its deadlier insectoid cousins. Still, its size and hard shell make it dangerous when it attacks. A eusocial creature, it cannot reproduce individually.

ThingDef.label: cobra
ThingDef.description: A large snake. Cobras can be highly aggressive if provoked - it's better to stay away from these creatures.

ThingDef.label: monkey
ThingDef.description: This monkey can use its curly tail to grab on to branches, leaving its hands free to do other things.

ThingDef.label: chinchilla
ThingDef.description: A small but quick rodent famous for its exceptionally soft fur.

ThingDef.label: boomalope
ThingDef.description: Engineered for chemicals production, the boomalope grows a large sac of volatile chemicals on its back. Though it is weak and fragile for its size, other animals have learned to avoid it because of the huge explosion it produces when it dies.

ThingDef.label: capybara
ThingDef.description: The largest natural rodent, the capybara is well-adapted for steaming jungle.

ThingDef.label: muffalo
ThingDef.description: A large herding herbivore descended from buffalo and adapted for some exotic environment. Peaceful unless disturbed.

ThingDef.label: iguana
ThingDef.description: These large lizards normally feed on plant matter. However, when angered, their tough hide and sharp claws make them quite dangerous.

ThingDef.label: rhinoceros
ThingDef.description: This large land mammal is typically quite peaceful, but it will not hesitate to charge with its horn to fend off trespassers.

ThingDef.label: dromedary
ThingDef.description: Adapted to survival in arid environments, this distant cousin of the horse can go weeks without water.

ThingDef.label: elephant
ThingDef.description: The largest unmodified land animal. It can use its tusks as tools for moving objects - or as deadly weapons.

ThingDef.label: deer
ThingDef.description: A medium-sized herding herbivore. Generally peaceful unless disturbed.

ThingDef.label: squirrel
ThingDef.description: One of the many hardy, versatile rodent species that follows humankind everywhere it spreads.

ThingDef.label: elk
ThingDef.description: A large member of the deer family, well-adapted to life in cold climates.

ThingDef.label: alphabeaver
ThingDef.description: A large beaver derivative genetically engineered to harvest wood with machine-like efficiency. In the absence of specialized feed, these animals will enter a manic state that compels them to eat trees whole.

ThingDef.label: wild boar
ThingDef.description: Although considered impure by some cultures, this hairy ancestor of the domesticated pig is prized for the gamey flavor of its meat.

ThingDef.label: boomrat
ThingDef.description: Either by deliberate genetic weaponization, or as an unusual defense mechanism, these rodent-like creatures create a powerful fire-starting explosion when killed.

ThingDef.label: hare
ThingDef.description: This small, solitary herbivore can swiftly hop away from danger.

ThingDef.label: tortoise
ThingDef.description: This heavily armored land-dwelling reptile is known for its slow moving speed and surprisingly vicious bite.

ThingDef.label: thrumbo
ThingDef.description: A gigantic creature of unknown origin. The thrumbo is gentle by nature, but extremely dangerous when enraged. Its long fur is exceptionally beautiful and valuable, and its razor-sharp horn is very valuable in most markets. Legends say that an old thrumbo is the wisest creature in the universe - it simply chooses not to speak.

ThingDef.label: chicken
ThingDef.description: The most traditional farm bird, the chicken is raised for its eggs and meat.

ThingDef.label: pig
ThingDef.description: The pig was one of the first animals domesticated by humans. It is commonly raised for meat and leather, and is easy to feed because of its omnivorous diet.

ThingDef.label: cow
ThingDef.description: A very common domestic animal. It can produce large amounts of milk, or be slaughtered for delicious food.

ThingDef.label: alpaca
ThingDef.description: A medium-sized ungulate closely related to the llama, the alpaca is often farmed for its remarkably soft wool.

ThingDef.label: warg
ThingDef.description: Heavily-muscled wolf-like creatures. Scientists say wargs are the descendants of weaponized military animals created for population suppression. The superstitious see them as the tools of an angry god.

ThingDef.label: yorkshire terrier
ThingDef.description: A small, even-tempered dog. Originally bred to hunt rats, it later became a show and companionship animal.

ThingDef.label: husky
ThingDef.description: A large, energetic dog with a thick fur coat for remaining comfortable in arctic environments.

ThingDef.label: labrador retriever
ThingDef.description: A very versatile, medium-sized dog. Originally bred to retrieve birds shot on the hunt, the lab is also an excellent guard dog, play pal, and family friend.
